FuncDef:
The packet-size command sets one or multiple sizes for NQA test packets.
The undo packet-size command restores the default test packet size.
By default, the test packet size is 512 bytes.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the size of packets in an NQA test instance.
The value is an integer ranging from 64 to 1518, in bytes. The default value is 512.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To set the size of NQA test packets in an Ethernet service activation test, run the packet-size &<1-10> command. This command allows a carrier network to transmit packets of various sizes in an environment close to real-world situations.
The packet in an Ethernet service activation test cannot be fragmented.
